ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class exposed me to multiple new verbs tenses, particularly in the subjunctive mood, and broadened my knowledge of useful areas of vocabulary (including religion, politics, and history).
I learned a large amount of Spanish vocab and grammar in a short amount of time. I feel much more confident in my Spanish speaking capabilities!
Knowledge of more advanced Spanish, compound clauses with "si", more advanced verb tenses and grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was a very strong course with few weaknesses. The pace was difficult, but that's expected from an intensive summer language course. I think more direction regarding the oral exam and allotting an extra 15 or so minutes for the first exam would be very helpful.

The course is intensive, so I got a lot out of it but I also didn't have as much time as I'd hoped to do other outside work. 

The course is structured excellently. It is challenging, engaging, dynamic, and fun! Both professors are lovely as well. I'm going to miss class with them!! I loved how much we learned about various cultures and the longer films from 130 and this course were highlights.

I really liked the podcast project. The only thing I'd say about it is that adding creative elements to it such as music was difficult because we were in groups. I think that maybe it could be cool to incorporate 1 individual creative project into the class so that we could more easily play around with fun presentations/editing etc.

The course materials / homework assignments / announcements are a little confusing and all over the place but overall the two professors that I had were outstanding and I've learned a lot in the course. One thing that I didn't like is that in our politics / economy unit, we had to have discussions to practice the vocabulary sharing our personal religious/ political views which honestly made me a little bit uncomfortable -- particularly the political aspect considering today's political climate.
Professor Valle and Yelsey were very involved with the intensity of the course and made it worth the while.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you're looking for the Spanish certificate this is a must, not only because it's required but also because it lays a really great foundation to take your Spanish to the next level.
Definitely! It is an excellent Spanish course!
I would, for me, it was a great follow-up to Spanish 130.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
